trap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece of equipment for catching animals
trap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The only way to catch mice is to set a trap.
He stepped into a bear trap covered in snow.
trap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
trap.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Police had set a trap for hooligans at the match.
Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
trap.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an unpleasant or difficult situation that is difficult to escape from
trap.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Amanda felt that marriage was a trap.
people caught in the unemployment trap
trap.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a vehicle with two wheels, pulled by a horse
trap.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a special gate from which a greyhound is set free at the beginning of a race
trap.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to prevent someone from escaping from somewhere, especially a dangerous place
trap.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The building collapsed, trapping dozens of people in the rubble.
There’s no way out! We’re trapped!
trap.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: Trap is often passive in this meaning
trap.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to catch an animal or bird using a trap
trap.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to catch someone by forcing them into a place from which they cannot escape
trap.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The police trapped the terrorists at a roadblock.
trap.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to trick someone so that you make them do or say something that they did not intend to
trap.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: I was trapped into signing a confession.
trap.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to get a part of your body crushed between two objects
trap.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Mind you don’t trap your fingers in the door.
trap.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to prevent something such as gas or water from getting away
trap.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: solar panels that trap the sun’s heat
